We arrived after a long journey from Yosemite but got there just in time for the complimentry wine tasting (between 5 & 6pm each night) Felt very under dressed in shorts etc as people were heading for dinner in Fifth Floor. Didn't really care after our drive, was just grateful to be welcomed so nicely and offered a glass of something chilled - what a start to our stay. Our room was a deluxe suite, one bedroom, divided from the lounge area by sliding doors. Our daughter had the sofa bed in the main part of the suite. Clean and spacious bathroom with hot tub, just what you need after walking the streets of SF. View from the window was of an inner courtyard but the advantage of that was that we were not disturbed by noise of the streets, it was very quiet. Fifth Floor restaurant was to die for. Service was quite slow on the evening we went, but food amazing and wine recommendations spot on. Couldn't fault this hotel in anyway and got a personal message from Michelle when we left. Would love to visit again, we loved SF.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: mariareier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a suite for 4 nights w/our two boys age 7 and 9. Everything about this hotel was fabulous! We upgraded to a suite for very little extra and it was huge, clean and luxurious. It completely made the trip feel like a getaway. Bed was super comfortable. We loved being on the 5th floor steps away from the nightly wine reception. The goldfish bowl was such a nice touch. It served as a nightlight for the kids and they even named him Goldie. The location could not have been better. Steps away from BART, Cable Car stop, bustop, Westfield Mall, Walgreens, restaurants, great stores for shopping. But since it was off a side street, we were far enough away from the chaos of the main Market Street area. The free coffee in AM, fruity water all day, yummy iced tea 2-4, then wine reception at night were such a nice bonus. This saved us so much money in buying coffee, water and drinks for the 4 of us. It was nice to be able to sign up for the Kimpton In Touch club. This gave us free wireless internet which we used daily and a mini bar credit which also came in handy. The service at Hotel Palomar could not have been better. We were there on our 12th anniversary trip w/our kids and we had actually come to San Francisco 12 years ago for our honeymoon. They treated us to Proseco (not sure how they knew this was my favorite!) & chocolate in our suite, then snacks and movies for the boys. Rachel at the front desk went above and beyond to be helpful and make us feel special here. She greeted us by name and got to know our boys. I must say though that I noticed many other guests being called by name which is a nice touch. The entire front desk staff was so nice, friendly and helpful. It's hard to say what I liked best since I liked so much about Hotel Palomar. But something I have not already mentioned is I liked not having to wait - for anything. Elevators were fast, was always someone at front desk ready to help us in seconds, asked for things from housekeeping and it came immediately. Bell service came immediately. This is very different from what we would have experienced at a larger chain type hotel. I think the kids favorite thing was the house dog Maverick. What a treat to have him hang out at the front desk and visit with him everyday. The only negative we experienced was in the hotel restaurant for breakfast. We decided to try it and take advantage of the Kids Eat Free promotion. It ended up being understaffed that day and the service was both slow and bad. After expressing concern we were treated much nicer but the main issue still came down to not enough people working and one person trying to do it all. I will say at night the French Fries were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and would recommend it”
Reviews.Author: ZinSkier
Reviews.Content: Our bellhop went out of his way to help us unload our car and get our bags to the room. The entire staff was wonderful. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and value”
Reviews.Author: EchoParkGal
Reviews.Content: I'm writing from our lovely room at the Palomar. My sister and I wanted a centrally located hotel and we chose well. We come to San Francisco often, and I would definitely stay at the Palomar again. After full days of shopping, sightseeing and dining, it is lovely to return to the quiet oasis of our room on the 6th floor (facing the garden). The manager and front desk staff are exceedingly kind and efficient. We were greeted upon arrival with many treats (check out their Facebook password game). The glass of wine each evening, fresh coffee in the lobby in the morning and ice cold, fruit infused water in the afternoon have kept us relaxed and refreshed each day of our 3-day stay. The room is very spacious by SF standards, and the housekeeping staff ensured it is both spotless and well stocked. I would recommend this hotel to anyone coming to San Francisco, it is the perfect urban retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accommodation in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Catapano
Reviews.Content: Recent stay at Palomar was delightful. Well located, clean and reasonable rates. The worst I can say is that the bathroom is a bit small. Had a pet goldfish in my room. Sweet and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - OK area”
Reviews.Author: mrsbarnes22
Reviews.Content: This was a quick trip for my brother and I and I have to say this hotel has some of the best customer service I have ever experienced and really great rooms. Within walking distance are great little eateries and cool neighborhoods. However, at night, the area gets a bit sketchy and my brother was actually mugged right outside of the hotel (say about 10pm - not that late). Now we live in another major city and this has never happened before so its not like we don't know how to act in a city. I would say keep this in mind - nice area in general during the day and definitely sketchy at night. With that said, I probably would stay here again if I caught another sale (I wouldn't pay full price) but I wouldn't be walking about much after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ychu30
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for work and the location was excellent. Convenient to BART and walking distance to other local sites including China town and Union Square. My favorite was that after a long day of conference, I would return to the hotel to see Maverick, their rescue chocolate lab, sitting at the front desk counter waiting to greet guests. Just brings a smile to my face. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Would definitely return and stay there again over the other higher price alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: LynnMA28
Reviews.Content: Location - Very easy walk to shopping, Union Square and Chinatown. Convenient to all modes of transportation; muni bus in front, rapid transit, cable and trolley cars around the corner. Relatively quiet when compared to the locations of other more expensive hotels we had checked out. Lobby - quaint (small) but well done. Several large dispensers of complimentary fruit-flavored waters available during the day. This is a dog friendly hotel (they have a dog on staff) and they have a water dispenser in the lobby for dogs. Room - Contemporary design, clean and spacious. Roomy bathroom, clean, good water pressure in the shower. Beds were very comfortable. Very quiet; I had asked for a room away from the elevators. We had an interior room on the 6th floor which overlooked a roof top garden. Front Desk - Very accomodating and genuine in their desire to answer all questions and provide recommendations for dining, traveling around the city, etc. Other Staff - Doormen, porter, chamber maids - again, very pleasant and responsive to requests. Amenities - Fitness center is very small but does have the basics, treadmill, stair climber, weights. Individual tvs on treadmill and stair climber. More than 4 people in the room at one time would be a crowd. Mini bar is well stocked but prices are steep. However we received a coupon upon check-in for a $10 raid on the mini-bar. What we didn't like : They charge $1 to make a local phone call (we didn't know that until after the fact). Phone books not provided in the rooms which would have been helpful when searching for restaurant ideas. (The front desk will however look up any info you need online and print out maps/directions.) Very limited drawer space for clothing. SF is an expensive town but the room rate is reasonable when compared to many other quality SF hotels in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “The important 4 Cs: Classy, chic, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: rftcbaby
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research when planning my first trip to San Francisco. I wanted to be close to everything or at least close to transit and I wanted a clean, boutique style room. The Palomar more than fit the bill. The lobby was lovely (I adore the Escher Inspired floor), and each and every encounter with the staff was so warm, gracious and lovely yet efficient. The hotel was quiet. Everything was pristine throughout and the room itself was so comfortable and well appointed. The bed was truly comfy. The room was also a really good size (something that stood out when searching for hotels as many were incredibly tiny in comparison). All the amenities were well appreciated and this stay definitely made me a fan not only of the Palomar but of Kimpton Hotels. Transit from the airport was easy with a hop onto the BART and the hotel itself is a quick 1 minute jaunt from the BART exit. For those who love shopping, this is in the middle of Union square a popular shopping area with lots of great little shops for everything. There are also lots of attractions and museums including the Museum of Modern Art and the Cartoon Art museum within blocks. San Francisco was fantastic! The Palomar for a return trip is a definite!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and touring”
Reviews.Author: BigDTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed while attending a conference at the Moscone convention center. The Moscone was only 2 blocks away, so very convenient. Easy to get to anything else in SF. Even though right on busy corner, was not bothered by any noise. The room was clean and nicely appointed; similar to other reviews, the bathroom was fairly small, but such a short stay it was adequate... and somewhat expected in SF. The other issue is that my room window looked right into a business with many cubicles and they could see right into my room. Had to draw the blackout curtains for most of the time in the room. Maybe ask for a front facing room. The staff was very good, even in limited lobby space. Even enjoyed petting the manager's lab, as I was missing mine. Didn't bring my running shoes, but should have as the conceirge said the staff goes on runs in the morning with guests. I went to go eat one evening in the hotel restaurant, and took some work, as when i'm eating alone, i like to do so at the bar and get some work done. Unfortunately the bar in the restaurant was so dark, that was not an option so went back up to the room and ordered room service which was ok. Due to location and great service, would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: l1eve
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. Staff was very friendly and helpfull. Our room was on the inner side and was big enough. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but practical. All very clean. The location (4th and Market) was great. A few steps away from the BART, busses and the famous cable tram. A lot to see in the area. The hotel offers a valet parking service; no worries if you prefer not to use this, as there are plenty of parkings in the area. The hotel offers free wifi, after signing up for the Kimpton mail list. We had a great stay and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay - right in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: velocitytime
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Kimpton Palomar! Our room on the top floor faced the street but we had no noise issues. The room was attractive, featuring comfortable beds, great amenities, and our goldfish Leonardo. This hotel is perfectly located at the intersection of Market Street and every imaginable form of transportation. A short walk from Yerba Buena Gardens, the Zeum, SFMoMA, Moscone, Union Square, Chinatown, the Ferry Building etc. etc. And the Apple store is right across the street (good for last minute tech issues). A most convenient base from which to explore the bay area. The staff is outstanding - from the front desk to housekeeping and the garage. Valet parking is not cheap but offers all day in-out privileges which in a town where a taxi can sometimes be hard to find, is good value. Tip: rent a hybrid and get a little off the garage fees. Be sure to leave some time to borrow one of the hotel's cool old-fashioned Dutch (Gazelle!) bicycles for a spin around town. Our family can't wait to go back to San Francisco and the Kimpton Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: paulscan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Our room was very spacious and the bathroom very good. The room was very clean, quiet and the bedding very comfortable. Has free internet during our stay which was most welcome.Loved the Aveda products in the bathroom which were in plentiful supply. We received a very warm welcome on our arival and the staff were always courteous and friendly and very helpful with suggestions. Check out was quick and easy. Location was excellent. Just a few steps from the Bart which made train travel to anfd from the airport so easy. Had dinner in the restaurant on one occasion but we thought it was a little bit expensive. However there are plenty of other restaurants nearby and several food courts which served good meals in a clean environment.

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfect...”
Reviews.Author: DomoMe
Reviews.Content: A great Kimpton Hotel that is in a perfect location near union square. I stayed in one of their suites on the top floor( I had gargoyles outside my window) and had an amazing bathroom with a Fuji Soaking Tub. The bed was amazing and animal print bathrobes were just fun. Make sure to ask for your pet goldfish during your stay. I called mine Wanda... I know... I know...Not very original. Free Wi-Fi if you join their frequent stayer program (it is free) and there is a free wine tasting party very night. Staff is friendly and helpful. The bar is great, with a decent selection of single malts and awesome barkeeps. My only issue is the very limited room service and the even smaller selection for breakfast room service..

Reviews.Title: “Great room; loved it here.”
Reviews.Author: love_to_travel72011
Reviews.Content: The room was a good size and very nicely decorated. The bed was comfy and there were plenty of pillows. The air conditioner worked well and kept the temperature of the room comfortable. The view from our room was of the inner court yard but that was fine because we spent most of our time walking around the city. The proximity to BART was great and the muni stops just outside the door of the hotel. The doorman was very pleasant and always opened the door for guests. I really enjoyed staying here and would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “An awesome home away from home with really nice people the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: MirPerl
Reviews.Content: This is a welcoming environment. People like Marcos and Lauren make this place what it is. Beyond the nice bedding, amenities, and complimentary wine happy hour it's truly the staff that makes this place what it is. Complimentary use of some pretty cool bikes and a small but decent gym were appreciated, too.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mthompsen
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms here for a family meet up in the city. We came from San Jose and travel to San Francisco a lot but the rest of the family was travelling down from the Eureka area. The Hotel Palomar has a great location, with everything you would possibly need just minutes away. The rooms were a great size and very clean. When we checked in the kids were greeted with their own kids backpack filled with goodies. They were very excited. Us adults took advantage of the wine in the lounge which made for a nice relaxing little treat. Would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hip hotel ... except the "fitness center" is appalling”
Reviews.Author: sc43
Reviews.Content: This is, in almost every respect, a very fine hotel. Cool decor, nice staff, great condition ... what's not to love? Well, for a large hotel, there are three pieces of cardio equipment in the gym. And one of those, the only elliptical machine, was so badly broken that it emitted headache-inducing shrieking sounds. I mentioned it to the management, but they didn't bother to get it repaired. Crazy, no, that a luxury hotel can't provide a even marginally decent fitness center?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wendyh26
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but the staff made us feel very welcome. It was our wedding anniversary and there was a chilled bottle of champagne and some candied almonds waiting for us. They also gave us an upgraded room with a jacuzzi tub. The bathroom was almost as big as the room LOL. We ate breakfast in the restaurant - delicious if a bit pricey. Also the location cannot be beat. Would definitely stay at the Palomar again. It's another homerun for Kimpton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: deadgrassdog
Reviews.Content: We love sneaking away to the city for a weekend stay. I surprised my wife on her birthday with a weekend stay at the Palomar. Staff was very attentive and took care of all of our needs. We had reservations to see Beach Blanket Babylon a must see when you are in the city it never gets old. Anyhow it was pouring rain and the hotel had arranged a car to drop us off and pick us up. They even made arrangement to drive us to our restaurant for dinner. We were treated like royalty! Overall I would have to say this has been our favorite place to stay when coming to the City nothing like the staff knowing your name and making you feel important. The rooms are very clean you can't go wrong when staying near Union Square if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and very nice to stay”
Reviews.Author: paulapim
Reviews.Content: I spent a weekend in San Francisco and one of the best things was the hotel because it is very well located and in addition, the room is very nice and cozy. It is very close to Union Square, cafes, restaurants, shops ... I recommend and would stay there again. The only thing I did not like was the price of valet parking, $45, I think they could lower it to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch, will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: SubyRS25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon. The staff was great and very helpful as we had never been to San Fran before. We got some great dinner recommendations from the concierge. Kimptons wine hour is a great way to start the night. Maverick, the pet relations manager, was a beautiful well-mannered chocolate lab that was there every day to greet us. The bed was probably the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Thank you Emilie Auger for helping make our honeymoon great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, central location”
Reviews.Author: LERinger
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Kimpton hotel and we were quite pleased. Loved the dog in the lobby -- he even has his own business cards! Room was nice, albeit a bit small. Location was good -- close to Union Square and shopping, and adjacent to the mall. Close to the end of the cable car line too. Area can be a bit sketchy, but at night we took cabs. We would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tobywoo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic stay at the Hotel Palomar. We spent 1 night for a girls trip and were very impressed with this hotel. The staff was amazingly professional and courteous. The room was very well decorated and spotless. Even though we were in a very busy area of San Francisco the rooms had triple pained windows and it was very quiet in our room. We had a very nice time at the complimentary wine hour. Location for this hotel is hard to beat. We requested more pillows and the staff brought more than we asked and different kinds to make sure we got what we needed. I would stay here again and I have already recommended it to friends. Thanks for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: JuanCarlosO
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a lot my stay at the Palomar SFCO. The hotel was great. The room was beautiful. Everything about this place was top-notch and upscale. You'd be crazy to not love this hotel. The location is perfect, just by Market Street, near all the means of transportation, 2 blocks away from Union Square; however the best is the staff. Everyone makes a true effort in giving 100% to make guests to feel like at home and they achieve results. Although Iâ€™ve been staying at Kimpton hotels with certain frequency when I travel to the US, this has been my best experience in terms of service. Definitively my choice for future travels to SF.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rexaford
Reviews.Content: I had the perfect stay on a five-day business trip. Incredibly friendly and accommodating staff, from front desk to bellman. Kudos to Maverick, the hotel dog, for adding his own special flair! I literally cannot suggest one area of improvement. (Location near Moscone Center was perfect for my purposes, but be aware of the huge homeless population you will encounter as soon as you step out the hotel door. Simply unavoidable in this area.)

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: SpottedOwlFamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. The room was beautiful. Everything about this place was top-notch and upscale. You'd be crazy to not love this hotel. My only problem with this hotel (and maybe it's an SF law area thing in general-not sure) - they had no travel size OTC medicines available for purchase (ie tylenol, advil, etc). Between the red-eye flight, the time change and the previous week I had just had to even get to town, by 5am San Fran time, I had a headache beyond measure and was told I needed to wait until the pharmacy around the corner opened...several hours later. Again, you would be crazy to not love this hotel - just don't leave your tylenol on the east coast if you're coming into town in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel Great Location Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kazzyvege
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late April, 2011. Our room was big and clean and the bed was out of this world comfy. There are not great views from this hotel but the location kind of overrides that, we weren't in the rooms enough to actually worry about this! The location of the hotel is right in the middle of everything. It is a short walk in every direction to some great restaurants (we found a fantastic Indian Restaurant just around the corner which was the best Indian food we ever had). The shopping is great and all the shops are located all around this hotel with the Westfield Shopping Centre around the corner which has THE best food court you will see. It is a short walk to the trolleys, underground and you can pick up a bus right outside the door. The staff are friendly and will grab you a taxi anytime day or night. The breakfast was included with the room which was probably the only letdown. It was a muffin, fruit and parfait which is ok if that is what you feel like but if you just want something easy don't buy the package. Highly recommend this Kimpton Hotel we had a great time and our group had no complaints about anything here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: yowzatx
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent: close enough to the Union Square area without being right in the middle of the hassle. The rooms are clean and modern, and the desk staff was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, kind staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Markkk014
Reviews.Content: Well, there's not much more to say to what has already been said. The location is perfect, just by Market Street, near all the means of transportation, 2 blocks away from union square. The hotel in beautiful, clean and room are very spacious. Becoming a member of intouch (Kimpton program) gave me access to free wi-fi and 10 bucks on the minibar. The staff is very friendly and helping. I loved the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to moscone”
Reviews.Author: kwtech
Reviews.Content: hotel staff very friendly. I got a very good rate by preparing and using my aaa discount. A combination of the two and i was able to get cheapist hotel rate near moscone for major convention. The hotel is geared toward business travelers. If bringing family with kids, try elsewhere. Hotel is 1 block from moscone, a half block from market st shopping, and 2 blocks from powell street cable car. Very chic hotel for business traveller. Reminds me of a W Hotel - but on a smaller quieter scale.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Service Scores Big”
Reviews.Author: tootalltraveler
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and flight options were limited so I arrived early. 9:30 to be exact. On a chance I inquired as to early check-in and....done. I was greeted warmly and cheerfully checked in by Rachel. I unpacked and was on my way to tour before my business the following morning. Again the front desk was very helpful in guiding me where to go and even let me know of a free lunch giveaway promoting a new lunch menu at a Kimpton restaurant a few blocks away. Hard to pass up free so I took the offer and it was just right to prep me for an afternoon of cable car and water front tourist activities. Every encounter with the staff was warm and friendly even when I locked myself out of my room. The room was very comfortable. Only one annoyance was the shower curtain rod was not curved so the curtain wanted to "hug" you until the air stabilized when showering. The price was a bit high when I compared with others in the area but not the highest. Overall service was great and I have no problem recommending the Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and upscale hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: tjconn728
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Palomar is its Market Street location - along many Muni bus and train lines, steps from a BART stop, and just a minute walk away from Union Square it provides a great home base from which to explore San Francisco by foot or public transit, especially if you are willing to brave the hills on the most direct route to the Fisherman's Wharf area. A multitude of restaurants are nearby, including one in the hotel that looked good but we did not have the opportunity to try. The lobby, halls, and room were clean and well-decorated, and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. The biggest negative of the Palomar was the design of the building itself. All the rooms are on the upper floors, and half of them face a narrow interior courtyard, making the rooms on the inside visible to all the others across the courtyard. The heavy curtains in the room block visibility, but also all sunlight, while the lighter curtains don't do much to help privacy. I also had difficulty connecting to the Internet wirelessly, but the staff brought an Internet cable to the room to help with that. Be sure to sign up for a free Kimpton In-Touch membership to get free Internet, otherwise it can become very expensive. The business center charges $6 for 15 minutes of Internet, and about $0.30 per page to print black and white (although boarding passes are free) so if you need to print anything small (tickets, coupons, etc) ask to email it to the front desk, who gladly printed a Groupon and Alcatraz tickets for me.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect city hotel with friendly service”
Reviews.Author: loveholidays58
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are excellant, so friendly and helpful, the concierge was great at planning our tours for us. The room we had was very comfortable and a decent size for a city hotel and we never heard any noise despite the hotel's central location. Personally I was a little dissappointed with the union square area so if I could pick this hotel up and place it near Fisherman's Wharf then it would be perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, modern, would have loved to stay longer”
Reviews.Author: cupid1127
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a quick overnight trip, I really hated that I had to check out the next morning because the room was pretty big, bathroom very modern and clean, bed was super- comfy. Definitely would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “clean. nice. perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ladygreenbird
Reviews.Content: my cousin was in town for business and i got to stay with her for two nights. i live in the city but i wanted a little get-away. my dog and i had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, as always”
Reviews.Author: rkst
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel for many reasons: It's located on Market Street & 4th, a step away from the Westfield, Conference Centre and Union Square. An excellent place for business and a bit of light shopping. The restaurant is excellent, a bit pricey but very good and the bar is friendly and nicely busy. The rooms are nice and big, always clean and with free internet if you're on the guest reward program.

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: mdwilliams007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights at the Palomar in early April as part of our delayed honeymoon and we were very impressed with this hotel. We chose it mainly because of its excellent location as it was very close to Union Square and the cable car turn table, which made it easy for getting around (although we often found it easier to simply explore the city on foot). When we arrived (after a very long flight) the reception staff were very friendly and quickly organised allowing us to get up to our room (an upgrade over what we had booked - much appreciated) and get out to grab some dinner. When we returned we found an ice bucket and bottle of wine in our room from the duty manager and their staff - another unexpected and nice touch. Our room was great, comfortable bed, clean bathroom and the room was a good size for a city center hotel. There was some street noise at night but this was something we expected with the hotel being so central and it's not exactly something the hotel could control. The room we initially booked was on the other side of the hotel (not overlooking the main street) so these may be quieter than the one we had. Although we didn't take advantage of the wine reception that was held daily (we were too busy out exploring) we thought this was also another nice touch. As was the courtesy call from the front desk the night before we checked out to check we had enjoyed our stay. This certainly wasn't the most affordable hotel stay we have ever had but we were happy that we got value for money from this hotel. We would certainly book to stay here again if we returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Caring and considerate service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Promontory
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in early April. The night of arrival I became very sick and could not attend the business meetings I was in town for the next day, Management and staff were very caring and considerate in several ways. Just a few examples were calling to check on me and proactively sending up a complementary tray of dry toast, juice and fruit to help me through the ordeal. I can attest that the beds are very comfortable, having spent many hours stuck in bed.The hotel is very centrally located, the rooms were comfortable and a good value for the price. The free wine and beer at 5 pm was enjoyed by my group and was a nice touch. There were just a few minor areas for improvement: sometimes it took them a long time to answer the phone, the quality of the bathroom amenities was not great, and the bathroom is very small and basic. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and appreciate how kind they were during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel. Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: FrankChaps
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic building with nice rooms with poor amenities and little extras. The staff ranged from very friendly to indifferent and just plain rude. Room service was slow to answer the phone and slow to deliver. One morning, our breakfast card we left hanging on the door wasnt even picked up. When I called the front desk, they were indifferent and didnt apologize or acknowledge a mistake had been made. A front desk attendant attempted to discipline our children in front of us quite rudely. There is a 45 dollar valet parking charge nightly and the GUESTS need to go downstairs and retrieve their own cars! They are not brought up for you. On a positive note, the bellmen were very friendly and helpful and the staff in the bar at night were extremely classy and friendly. For the price, stay at the Four Seasons. You'll get much better service and amenities for the same prices. We stayed at the Hotel Monaco a few years back which is a much better hotel. We will not stay at Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: FiAndyB
Reviews.Content: The staff were super helpful and responded to e-mails very promptly. Our room was fantastic, contemporary and looked recently decorated. Our king size bed was comfy and we had an enormous, deep whirlpool bath. The room was very quiet, despite overlooking the main street. It was easy to catch a $2 tram ride outside the door to take you to North Beach, but there are loads of great shops nearby, as well as the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art 5 mins away. Also in the vicinity are a few good bars and restauraunts. Can't fault it really.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, beautiful hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: barbtravels6
Reviews.Content: The national reservation system was down when I first attempted to make reservations. I had to call the hotel directly. Because of this, I was able to make personal contact with the hotel staff. That personal connection remained for the entire time I, and by 21 year old daughter, stayed at the Hotel Palomar in San Francisco. We were staying in SF for just a day and a night to have a mother/daughter night. The hotel inquired about the purpose of our stay. When they found out we were trying to spend some time together, they went out of their way to provide us with wonderful amenities. Not only did they upgrade our room, but they left us a personal note welcoming us and assuring us that they would provide anything we needed. When we got to the hotel, they immediately assisted with both our baggage and the car. We were checked in quickly- greeted by names and welcomed by wonderful staff and a beautiful dog. We immediately felt as though we were being pampered, nurtured and cared for- in a lovely hotel- by people who cared. Everyone seemed to know our name and everyone wanted to make sure that we were enjoying ourselves, that the room was set up to our liking and that we were able to get to the places we wanted to go. The suite that they put us in was wonderful. Not only did it look great - but it was pristinely clean, bright and cheery. The bathroom was impeccably clean and the products they provided were spa quality. Because I joined their 'in touch program', they knew I liked extra towels and a particular type of pillow. All of those items were waiting for us. Shopping was first on our agenda and we were a half block away from some of San Francisco's best shopping. When we returned, we had a tray of fresh fruit and cheese and bread waiting for us. Additionally, the hotel offers a hosted wine hour. We went down to the bar and were immediately offered a choice of lovely wines. Of course, it started pouring that evening. The hotel had umbrellas if we needed them and immediately hastened to assist us in getting a cab. They had recommendations for great dining and when we came in from our meal, made sure that that was satisfactory as well. Later, my daughter wanted desert from room service. The room service was delivered quickly and efficiently and she thought it was delicious. I had a bit of work to do and I was able to get on the internet quickly as well. The internet is offered free for guests- a very nice perk. We hated to leave the next day as we felt we were saying goodbye to friends. Checkout was as easy and efficient as check in. I look forward to my next stay in San Francisco. I will always be on the lookout for Hotel Palomar in general and will definitely return to the hotel in SF- despite the fact that there are hundreds of other choices. I think the hotel is wonderful choice for everyone- be it someone on a business trip- the location is perfect or someone on a leisure trip- as it's central location- near SF's esteemed cable cars and shopping is right at your fingertips. The price point is more than great and the amenities are like those at much higher priced hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with thoughtful employees in the BEST location!”
Reviews.Author: RobS42
Reviews.Content: I just returned home from my second stay at the Palomar this year, and it's a true gem of a hotel! Every form of public transportation in S.F. is extremely near--I took BART from SFO since it stops a few steps from the hotel. Upon entering the lobby, which was appropriately staffed, I was greeted and the check-in process was very pleasant and efficient. When I arrived in my suite, I was amazed at the size. The bathroom was very spacious, the sitting area had plenty of seating for 4 guests, and the bedroom door could be closed if anyone wanted to nap. The decor was contemporary without being trendy, and the suite was cleaner than any hotel room than I've previously stayed in. My room overlooked a beautiful rooftop garden. The free morning coffee bar is a nice touch for anyone who quickly needs to catch transportation. The best part about the hotel is the friendliness of the staff and their willingness to help me. For instance, I had packages that were postmarked that I didn't have time to take to the P.O., and the front desk handled the mailing for me. I've never left any feedback of this sort, but the combination of the Palomar's beautiful rooms, cleanliness, great staff and location lead me to say it is THE BEST choice in S.F.! I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: LAPlatinum
Reviews.Content: If you want boutique hotel luxury in the thick of things in San Francisco with convenient local transport, proximity to both Union Square and the Moscone Convention Center AND you don't want generic blah, blah hotel experiences, then you will love this gem of a hotel. I stayed in a sister property in December (see my review of Hotel Palomar, Washington, DC) and fell in love with the service and attention to a guest's needs. If I have learned anything from staying at this hotel, it is their attention to meeting your every need, but the key is that they are not mind-readers and you need to speak up if any single thing is not to your liking. Don't like a meal? They will make it right or comp you. Unhappy with amenities? They will fix things. Really, Palomar goes out of the way to make sure your stay is perfect and that you receive attention from individuals who are decision-makers. It really is like Sax 5th Avenue, not Macys. Arrival: Instantaneous check in with the room available I had requested: Zen garden for quiet. Flavored waters to quench your thirst. Room: Beautifully appointed, spacious. Massive king bed with the feather pillows I had requested. Complimentary Internet with quick log-in because I am an InTouch member. (Join: it's free and there are little perks for members.) Choice of 3 newspapers every day and I could have all three. I had requested a complimentary goldfish "friend" in his own tank, which I had also requested in DC when my children were with me. Food: I did not try room service on this occasion, but did dine at 5th Floor for dinner. Nothing short of spectacular, truly. My server really knew wines and did perfect pairings with my choices. The layers of flavors in the fresh asparagus salad and then in the ravioli were complex and sublime. That said, I strongly suggest the hotel upgrade breakfast service. Very costly for offerings that were mediocre. Overall: On weekdays, there is a wine hour with complimentary white or red. Nice touch, but DC hotel did offer champagne, too. Should have asked! Hotel is pet-friendly but I emphasize that the place has no "doggy" smell nor have I even seen many in 2 stays at 2 different properties. (1 friendly lap pooch on this trip was it. I understand there may be a floor reserved for people with pets, but not certain.) Because I was attending a conference, I think my rate was better than most, but I recommend you watch for their specials or call them directly to see if you can get a better price. In summary, I would return in a heartbeat to this Palomar or any other!

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: LuciaBertin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and the best of it they are petfriendly!! I traveled with my family and enjoyed our stay! The people there is very nice but we only had one problem! At the moment of our check-out the lost our open vocuher that we left for extras! The room was already prepaid! So after we left they charged us the whole stay again :s

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: phatbear
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this is the finest hotel i've stayed in the U.S. Location was ideal, spitting distance from the BART (powell street) which is perfect if you are arriving from SFO airport, also there's great transport links out of the front door, including a cable car turning point 100 meters away. Also convenient from shops/food outlets etc etc. The rooms were spacious and clean, bathroom spotless, infact everything you would need in a hotel. The staff were always polite and welcoming and happy to help with any enquiries. Only grumbles I had were: the safe is in a closet with no light in it which is a tad strange, and the safe was perched on a wobbly stand, room 622 if anyone from the hotel is reading. Un-neccesary hoops to jump through to get access to the wifi, ok its free and its only a matter of signing up to their "kimpton intouch" scheme but surely any guest should be able to access the wifi without having to sign up to a programme. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. these grumbles are very very minor. Would i suggest this hotel to a friend, yes Would I stay here again, yes in a heartbeat, but I think this will be our only trip to SF

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton doing what it does best”
Reviews.Author: Nicochico
Reviews.Content: My first trip to San Francisco I decided to stay at the birth place of Kimpton Hotels at the Hotel Palomar. The first interaction with Lauren (Concierge) was great and everything from there on out was outstanding. The room was clean, large and had a great city view of the Apple store...where people lined up for blocks for the new Ipad! Tried out the 7AM run and it was great, Tiffany was inviting and was open to talk about the city and her job, it would be great if all hotels gave guests this opportunity to create a bond with workers. Overall a great stay and a quick shoutout to Ung for everything he did from wine hour, to leading morning runs to helping me out with anything that I may have needed. Keep up the awesome work Palomar!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: moochingaround
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The staff were excellent and Matt, the doorman, was very pleasant. The breakfast was a small continentbut one but was fine for us. The room was a decent size and overlooked the main street. There was no noise from the street. We had a goldfish in our room on arrival as had requested it for our children when we booked the hotel. Close to shopping and the cable cars and Bart. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Location, but not worth current rates.”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveler61
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Palomar hotel several times in the past 4 years, and enjoyed the stay, primarily due to the excellent location of the hotel. The wine reception is a nice way to end the day in the city. The rooms are clean and the furnishings are nice. My major complaint about this hotel at this point is the outrageous prices that are being charged. This is a 4 star hotel, and the current prices are what one would expect to pay for a 5 star property. I have had nice rooms there in the past for less than $150 per night, and now I am seeing rates of $450-$500. It's a nice hotel, but not nice enough to warrant such an extravagant rate increase.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal services during the day and way over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwilark
Reviews.Content: Plenty of better hotels in San Fran. Rooms with minimal offerings - no kettle for instance. Nowhere to eat for lunch. Patchy bar service at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value, nice people, great resturant.”
Reviews.Author: andrewbommer
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. So close to a great mall and shopping. Super nice people who took care of anything we asked for. Every morning a super nice emloyee will lead you on a morning run! How cool is that?! We had fantastic meal in the restuarant lounge. The parking was expensive at like $45 a night or something. And the fitness center was very small - but we still loved the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value boutique with central location”
Reviews.Author: MarkTwainMe
Reviews.Content: Hotel Palomar is located only yards from the Four Seasons, which shows that a great location doesn't require paying a fortune. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are comfortable, well decorated and up to spec in terms of TV, bathroom, lighting. Free internet service if you join their hotel loyalty club is also a plus. Their restaurant is top-notch, serving French cuisine with an American style. Only suggestion there is to train the wait staff a bit more: no need to ask to clear the plates when they're empty! And no need to check in on whether the meal is good 3-4 times. But this type of oversolicitous attention is not uncommon at the most expensive restaurants so these are quibbles. I didn't check out the gym, which is described as small, opting instead for Club One which has an arrangement with the hotel for a $15 day fee but is about 9 minutes' walk away, and for Sports Club LA which is around the corner but open only to members from other clubs.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: roadie1739
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Very close to union square and all the shopping that is in the area. Also close to some great restaurants. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful from the first time we walked through the doors. We were upgraded to a city view room, which was great. Very clean. Good amenities. The wine reception is a nice touch. No complaints. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Found by accident...AMAZING find!”
Reviews.Author: martymania85
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend found this place by accident ( we were going to stay at the Parc 55). What an amazing find, the service was great and super friendly. The location is near the bart stop, like 1/2 block walking distance, near everything ( muni, bart, downtown, cable car stop). The room modern, and very homey and cozy. The bed was SUPER comfortable and the room is very isolated form the hustle and noise of the street. They are also pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Model for Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Sleepless_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Hotels in San Fran have really impressed me. If you sign up for their rewards, you get free wireless access. All other hotels charge $10-$20/day for this service (unless you are some metallic level...silver, gold, platinum) ;) They have a wine tasting every evening for all guests. They don't discriminate based on whether your hotel was booked through them, a travel agent, expedia type site or even Priceline !!! Again all other hotels treat you differently if you are booking came from a third party website. One incident that I remember was when my wife was running late from shopping and couldn't join me for the wine tasting. The person doing the wine tasting realized this and offered us an entire bottle to try out in our room. Fantastic !! She was empowered to do that without having to check with the CEO, like employees in for instance the Hilton group of hotels have to do :) Another incident: Pres Obama was staying at the Marriott opposite the Palomar. since the street had restricted access, the Palomar gave each guest a "San Francisco" coffee mug in their room along with chocolates to apologize for any inconvenience. Pros: Excellent service Great uniform treatment of all guests Location Cons Rooms are a bit dated I personally don't care for the "cheetah" print gowns :)....but they are whimsical I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 Location, gr8 staff”
Reviews.Author: ozzycruisers
Reviews.Content: Room was super quiet - terrific for getting over jet lag from Australia. Room was clean and roomy. The staff on the front desk, particularly Michelle, could not have been more helpful, with things to do and restaurants etc - she made all the bookings there and then for us even suggesting to use the 'Dine out Deal' going on in San Fran that week. Close to everything! Loved the Managers dog doing the Meet & Greet !Free Wine Happy Hour was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Every staff member was genuinely friendly”
Reviews.Author: clivebear
Reviews.Content: Great location,near shopping mall. Lovely coffee free in morning and wine hour Very clean,and plush towels. Front desk staff,best ever

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in”
Reviews.Author: Toni12391
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is not only in a great position, the staff were friendly and helpful - especially the doorman. The king room was pretty tight but the bed was the most comfortable bed I have every slept in. We had a view above the courtyard - which probably meant it was quieter even though the view from our friends' double double room was nicer. Can't comment on the restaurant as it was undergoing renovation. Wine receptions were a nice touch. I think the only thing I can't get my head around is why so many US hotels don't provide tea & coffee making facilities in the room. They did have tea & coffee available on the 5th floor but who really wants to get dressed in the morning to go fetch their first coffee. But they did have filtered cold water in reception available 24hours a day - a really nice touch when coming in from a day out. All in all would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely consider other Kimpton Hotels based on our experience here. Thanks Hotel Palomar.

Reviews.Title: “I dare you to find a better hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: kara10002
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel - our bags took three days to come from Sydney to San Francisco and this hotel went beyond the call to locate our baggage for us. All staff at the hotel were made aware of our situation. They recommended places to buy replacement items, provided complimentary tea to our room at night and - wait for it - sent staff out to the airport on the third day to personally look for our luggage! WOW! I dare you to find a more caring, professional and hard working team of people. Without their input I doubt our bags would have arrived at all! Daniel and Rachel - you are the best!!!! The complimentary wine reception from 5-6pm was wonderful which included hot chocolate and warm apple cider which my daughter loved!! The beds are comfortable, the rooms are spacious and immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “First rate service”
Reviews.Author: 3dayweekender
Reviews.Content: GM Christopher bent over backward to accomodate our every request. Wonderful staff did the same, extra special perks included an upgrade, a minibar credit, and free wi-fi with Kimpton rewards. If you follow them on Twitter you'll get a magic password for perks. We felt like we could ask for anything and our genies would grant our request. Delicious room service breakfast! A short walk to the Metreon and Union square make for a fabulous location. I'd highly recommend trying this place! Thanks for everything Chris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Reefwatcher
Reviews.Content: Right off the corner of 4th and Market Streets, the Hotel Palomar is in an ideal location for exploring San Francisco. Public transportation is just steps away, with a BART station, streetcar line, bus stops, and even the Powell cable car all within a block. The hotel is beautiful and modern, and my room was quiet and extremely comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and well-designed, the bed luxurious, the lighting was well-placed, and there were numerous other thoughtful touches throughout, like the animal print bathrobes that are provided for guest use, and the IPod docking station/alarm clock. This hotel is a good value in an expensive city, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistent”
Reviews.Author: javsigx101
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps my fifth or sixth stay over the past 7 years. It is a fantastic property and has everything to make your stay in San Francisco a pleasant one. Its location can't be beat. You are on Market St. just off Powell, close enough to the Embarcadero/Financial District for the business traveler and perfectly positioned if you are a tourist. I had to use BART several times and there is a station entrance right around the corner. I have been in many different room types on low floors, high floors back and front. This is a very quiet hotel with spacious clean, comfortable rooms. I had room service twice for breakfast - everything came as ordered and on time. I have only eaten in the restaurant once, it was great and lives up to its reputation. The staff here is also what sets it apart. I asked for a late checkout on my departure date and it was granted without a charge. Gestures like this will get me to continue to use this hotel as it has been wonderfully consistent throughout the years. Do not hesitate to stay here, you will have a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!! First class service!”
Reviews.Author: Umailop
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful stay during veterans day weekend! Everyone at the Palomar was first class and made me feel like a star. Rachel at the front desk remembers me from my first visit back in July and always refers to me by name! I feel as if we've been friends for years! I used the winter promotion password at check in and was generously rewarded with a bunch of goodies. The location can't be beat, 4th and market is central to everything in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for business or tourism”
Reviews.Author: dephal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Palomar several times now; it's one of my favorite places to stay in the city. If you're there for business or pleasure, the location can't be beat: lots of things are within easy walking distance and Muni and BART stop right in front. There are tons of restaurants very close-by with a variety of price ranges and cuisines. The rooms are large by San Francisco standards and the staff has always been very friendly and helpful. The Palomar's not inexpensive (and parking is pretty pricey) but they have good government rates and they often run good specials. WiFi is free if you belong to Kimpton's (free) loyalty program. Because the hotel is right on Market Street, some of the rooms can have a fair amount of street noise. Also, the lobby is pretty small. There's no coffee maker in the room, but there's water in the lobby and free wine at 5pm, as well as coffee outside the restaurant in the morning. Overall, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Personable Hotel With Great Location”
Reviews.Author: StellaCO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located in downtown San Francisco, which made it easy to walk to surrounding shops and restaurants. It's location also meant that a busy bus stop was right outside the front door but generally the traffic was manageable. The cold and flavored water in the lobby was a nice touch as well as the wine hour on the fifth floor lounge that had complementary coffee in the morning. The "Deluxe King" room which we stayed in was small in size but had good functionality and a decent view of the courtyard and Old Navy store below. Parking was $42/night, which is typical for a downtown hotel, but be prepared to pay the extra fee.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnappleTerrill
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights while attending a conference across the street at the Marriott Marquis. The hotel overall was very nice and comfortable for the most part. I generally love most Kimpton properties so admittedly Iâ€™m biased, as I prefer these type of boutique stye hotels over the big box hotels (e.g., Marriott Marquis). Nonetheless, there were two issues that distracted from my stay. First, I asked for a quiet room (my top concern while traveling, and clearly noted in my InTouch profile) and was placed in room 742 directly across from the De Young meeting room on the 7th floor. Unfortunately, I did not notice the meeting room until after I had all my stuff unpacked. Over the course of my stay the noise coming from the various meetings taking place was bothersome. I did not request a room change simply because I did not want to re-pack my stuff and move. I did mention, politely, the issue upon check-out, but the front desk clerk simply said â€œsorry about that.â€� That was disappointing as a small credit for this inconvenience should have been considered. A second more minor concern involves the prices at the Fifth Floor restaurant. I do not mind paying (to an extent) premium prices for the ambience and comfort of this type of place, but $9 for a simple lettuce salad (minuscule in size) and $24 for an overly smallish entree of mushroom risotto seemed outlandishly high. While I still greatly enjoyed staying at the Hotel Palomar, these two issues (especially the first) will give me pause before booking another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: LizC62
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great location, friendly staff. The feature that is unusual is the free wine and beer from 5-7pm each night in their very cool lounge on 5th floor. We also had the Chef's Tasting Menu one night and that was very good.

Reviews.Title: “It is always a great experience staying at The Palomar”
Reviews.Author: LA-Backdoc
Reviews.Content: This is the place we usually stay at in San Francisco. It is a block from The Metreon and a few blocks from our favorite gallery, The Catharine Clark Gallery. We often fly up from LA for the weekend to attend openings at The Catharine Clark Gallery. The hotel seems small when you enter the lobby but it is actually HUGE. The only reason I gave it a four for location is the number of pan-handlers on the streets near the hotel. From Oakland Airport take the BART Bus to the BART Station and take the BART into the city, get off at Montgomery Station and it's less than a block to the Hotel. From SFO you can take BART directly to Montgomery Station. If you want a dead-quiet sleep experience ask for an inside room, no amazing view of the San Francisco skyline but, zero noise from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for a woman on solo business trip”
Reviews.Author: jpsanpedro
Reviews.Content: Return trip to Palomar after visit in 2004, provided the perfect base to business conference (at Hilton Union Square). Luxurious + comfortable + great service. All the usual Kimpton touches (wifi, coffee, wine) were a big help, plus they went above and beyond -- room upgrade (make sure to check their facebook page), delivering goldfish to the room upon request (which this property usually doesn't do), extending late checkout. (Complimentary wine was better than choices at a great restaurant at Ferry biulding.) Especially helpful in providing a welcoming "base of operations" after checkout prior to taking a super late red eye -- even inviting in to that evening's free wine hour. (And of course, well appointed room with great view, but that's almost secondary.) Compared very favorably with husband's fine but not spectacular stay at Le Meredien a month apart. While we still love Argonaut, this would have to be the "business" hotel of choice in SF.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: MrsClinton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. I extended a business stay for 2 nights in downtown San Francisco and loved the Palomar. Whilst it's bang smack in the middle of the shopping precinct above the Old Navy store, on a very busy corner, the noise from the street was almost non existent. I was in room 507 which was quite near the bar and restaurant but again, noise levels were fine, particularly as those services were not open late. The room had 2 double beds and was very spacious with 2 huge windows overlooking 4th street with plenty of light. Beds were extremely comfy and the temp in the room was just right. I joined Kimpton and had free internet and a $10 mini bar voucher. Little touches make the place perfect including the wine hour and coffee and tea in the morning, and the decor which is very stylish. Sadly i didn't meet Maverick the doggie as he had been naughty. The staff were excellent. I come to SF quite often and would love to stay in the Palomar again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: myahunters
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - between two BART stops - and has excellent service. My room was big enough, with a desk to work and I liked the space. I would recommend joining Kimpton's reward program (it is free) and it gives you free wi-fi and two items from the mini-bar. The Palomar has a daily wine hour and non-alcoholic options. At times you can hear some street noise, so this may not be the best option if you are a light sleeper as this hotel is in a busy part of town. Overall, it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: rojomunster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won a free trip to San Francisco and we stayed at the Palomar. This hotel is gorgeous inside and out. The room was very clean and fresh. The bed was like sleeping on s cloud. Anytime I was in our room I was wearing the robe, so comfortable. Also, all of the guest services were extremely kind and helpful. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: UtahFamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: I will start off with end....the service was spectacular, the location couldn't have been better, rooms are very clean and well appointed...that being said it is an old building and definately a "boutique" hotel. It is not the Ritz or Four Seasons with all of the touches a newer hotel has but I do think it lives up to 4 stars and I would stay there again. Now to the beginning...we booked our room through skoosh, got an awesome rate not knowing the Giants were going to win the World Series, got there to check in early and they couldn't find our reservation. Daniel at the front desk handled all of the phone calls to figure out the discrepancy and in the end skoosh had us booked at their sister hotel, The Serrano. Anyway, long story short, skoosh made the mistake and the Palomar honored our reservation and just for the inconvienience of it all they gave us a fabulous room!! The 8th floor corner room with a wall of windows that overlooked Market Street that gave us a front row seat to the parade. It was our 14th anniversary and Daniel made every effort to see that we had a fabulous stay...he even sent up a bottle of champaign. My first trip to San Francisco was awesome and it was because we had such a nice welcome at the Palomar. Thank you Daniel and your four legged friends!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again for sure.”
Reviews.Author: sonshine-lover
Reviews.Content: Located near the Marscone Center, Hotel Palomar was a great hotel for our stay. The rooms are very nice, flat screen tv, comfortable beds (the pillows were very thick and hard, but we only had to ask, and flatter, down-filled pillows were delivered to our room promptly) and a nice bathroom with Aveda amenities. The free wine reception every evening for an hour was lovely, as was the beautiful coffee set up on the fifth floor every morning. Excellent service. Several free newspapers offered every day. Small fitness room available but jogging in San Francisco is great. 2 Michelin stars restarant on the Fifth floor. Pet friendly--they even have a resident chocolate lab in the lobby for you to pet! Quiet hotel on a busy street. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This place gets it right on most every level”
Reviews.Author: 5gordons
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel Our first stay at a Kimpton, but not our last. It was our anniversary, and we were nicely greeted by a room upgrade and a bottle of sparkling wine. The room was great. The bathroom was decent, but not the best, but we're not there for bathrooms. The hotel was a feel-good kind of place. The concierge recommended a couple of bang-on restaurants that got us away from the tourists and made us feel like locals. The wine reception at the hotel each evening was a nice way to relax after a full day on the town, and a great way to get set for the evening. The location could not be beat. SoMA has a lot of neat places to explore, but it is really a Union Square/Market Street location that is convenient to everything. We had breakfast on Union Square, walked through Chinatown, North Beach, up Telegraph Hill, then to Pier 39 and Ghirardelli Square. From there a single bus took us right back to the hotel's front door on time for the wine reception! Go here!

Reviews.Title: “Modern contemporary design, with real comforts, and eager to please service”
Reviews.Author: ABK77
Reviews.Content: The only one disappointment of our stay was that upon arrival, after a long 6 hour flight, our intended room with two queen beds was "not available". As travelling friends who have known each other for far too long, this was "okay" but not an ideal way to start. The hotel totally redeemed itself by moving all our things to the penthouse floor the following day while we were out, to a room with two queen beds, where we stayed the rest of our visit. The wine tasting was a great touch, and with generous tastings. The personell always friendly, even at 3am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite San Francisco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mme_X
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I spent 5 nights in San Fran for a conference at the Moscone Center, and other events at a nearby chain hotel that is the largest in San Francisco. While the latter is good (I've stayed there in the past,) the Palomar provided a better experience and value all around at a somewhat lower price. It is a short walk to the Moscone Center, and is centrally located to other short-walk attractions like Union Square and the Chinatown gate. It is very near a stop for the tram/streetcar and other mass transit options (and frankly, across the street from that major chain hotel where all the taxis seem to line up.) The San Fran Museum of Modern Art is a short walk. The Ferry Building is at the end of Market Street, either by tram or a good walk if you are in the mood. The spacious 2-bed room #720 was great for our purposes (I invited my sister during the stay.) The decor was sleek-modern but warm and comfortable. While overlooking busy Market Street and up towards Union Square, this room was very quiet except for the occaisional ambulance or fire truck -- and even those noises were subdued; we could have slept through it. Looking out over the life of a city is something we enjoy as long as it is quiet enough. This hotel does sound-proofing very well, even when it seemed like it was pretty full. Still, there was a nice-enough courtyard if you want more buffer with an inner-facing room. The beds were soooo comfortable, with a selection of pillows and bolsters for sleeping, reading, etc. There are perfect-weight, not-too-warm duvets and top sheets with quality linens. A/C worked quietly and perfectly. Good-size closet and drawer space. All of the usual-or-better amenities in a good business class hotel are there -- iron & board, mini bar that had room to store a few things besides the stocked items, safe (roomy but not large enough for my laptop,) good laundry service, high-quality towels, Aveda toiletries, large desk/work surface, good flat-screen TV and options, etc. There are a few extra-nice things: wonderful robes, an umbrella if it rains, complimentary quality newspapers like the New York Times and Wall Street Journal as well as the local SF paper, etc. Complimentary internet access (although you may have to register as a member of "the club" -- free -- I forget.) My incredibly minor, nit-picky gripe: the clock radio does not have a light-up dial, so it was hard to tell the time if you woke up at night. There was no in-room coffee maker, but excellent coffee/tea is served in the lounge 6 - 9 a.m. FREE wine is served 5-6 in the same area, but you could take it up to your room. It was nice to have this there when dressing for dinner or you just want to put your feet up, although the lounge is sociable, modern-sleek and comfortable. 'No stingy attitude by the wine server, either. Chilled waters in urns in the lobby provide refreshment throughout the day/evening. Spotless, friendly housekeeping. Exellent, helpful staff throughout, but Matt at the door deserves special attention for his helpfulness and advice. I had a wake-up call every morning that arrived right on time -- with a REAL PERSON at the other end!!! MUST MENTION the excellent restaurant, Fifth Floor. We dined well at many restaurants in San Fran, but this was a highlight of an American menu with French preparations. Small plates and mains provide a lot of variety and while note cheap, well-priced for this level of quality and menu. While not a large menu, the variety is good and there is lots to like. There were a few complimentary amuse-gouts surpises, too. Nice cheese selection of note. I understand that there may be a new chef in November, but we'd be happy with the one currently on duty. The waitstaff and hostess were friendly, polished professionals. I'd go back in a minute, even if I wasn't staying at this hotel. Also: the bar area is very comfortable with the bar and tables, and you can get dinner there, too, if you'd prefer not to be at a table in the restaurant. I've done this before when I was on my own and the restaurant was booked (which is how I learned about this hotel.) There is also a chocolate labrador dog at reception every day, 8-5, which reinforces the hotel's support of animal rescue and care. No business center to speak of, but the service at the desk makes up for it, e.g. will print boarding passes complimentary, ship things, etc. How much do I love this hotel? IT belongs to the Kimpton hotel group. I will now check the Kimpton directory when I travel to other cities, and hope that it meets the standards set by the Palomar. On a return visit to San Fran, I will check this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Audiodoc
Reviews.Content: We started our trip on business at Half Moon Bay and stayed at the oh so fabulous Ritz Carlton. This was a hard act to follow, but wanted to end our trip with a special 2 nights in San Francisco. We were very disappointed with this property as well as the service. The property itself was very dark and dreary. We were out of our hotel room all day on Sunday, back at 5pm only to find our room was not cleaned. Back in the room 5 minutes, husband in the shower and here comes housecleaning wanting to get in to clean the room. Breakfast room was dirty and service was extremely slow due to understaffing. Our previous stay in San Francisco was at the Hotel Vitale and it was such a special and memorable place, the Hotel Palomar was not even close in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Chicquita2
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at the Palomar during our trip the San Francisco. The room was modern, clean, and cozy. The hotel was located right on the main shopping street and close to many attractions. The best surprise is the happy hour each day that includes sangria and wine. Would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and accomodating staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jtp888
Reviews.Content: This was the sponsor hotel for a conference I attended in June 2010. The staff were welcoming and helpful in accomodating my business and family needs. They helped us with restaurant recommendations and directions with a warm and friendly attitude. The hotel is located in a central area, at Market, near the SFMoMA and the Trolley line. The room we stayed in was spacious, clean and smartly decorated. It even came with a goldfish for my preschooler! We had a fantastic, but expensive, breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would not hesitate to book it again on my next trip to SF. My only reservation is that the hotel accommodates dogs, and given that I'm allergic to these lovable creatures, it would have been nice to know in advance. That being said, I NEVER suffered any allergic reaction as a result.

Reviews.Title: “Reflection of the signs of the times....”
Reviews.Author: kid_at_heart17
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Hotel Palomar in 2000 when it was somewhere newly opened. From my several trips to and from the US and to San Francisco, my return this year to this hotel would have been a homecoming... NOT! What used to be the Hotel Palomar noted for being a boutique luxury hotel was terribly terribly all wrong. Perhaps it had something to do with a travel agent in the Philippines using another travel agent in the US, booking this hotel for me. I was charged $380 per night for a King Deluxe and breakfast was $35 per head. I eventually found out that continental breakfast was only $14.50 and that if I had booked through the internet, it would have just been $1 breakfast for two. For the last 5 years I had never booked my trips through the travel agency but corporate policies which are still living in the dinosaur ages dictate that we need to go through a travel agent for auditing purposes. Nevertheless, let me say that the King Deluxe was a letdown. There was no water available in the room (you had to buy it at the nearest Walgreens) and the place looked very desolate. The ambience overlooking the awkward looking Zen garden looked sad and pathetic. There was no view. While the room was kept clean by the cleaning lady, there needs to be a makeover and the carpets need to get changed as it smelled musky and moldy. The bathroom was small and the shower curtains (who still uses shower curtains?!?!) were smelly. This was another place in the room that needed a major makeover. Finally was the food. For $14.50 for a continental breakfast, one could get a more decent meal in the next door Westfield Mall for the same price! Talk about having a muffin, some fruits, a croissant, a cup of coffee or fruit juice for this price? There wasn't even yoghurt to go. Geez!! The fitness center was really tiny and you probably are better off jogging in your room than in the tiny place they called Fitness Center. Of course, coming from Sofitel Los Angeles last July and comparing what Sofitel offered and the price I paid for Hotel Palomar was a no brainer. I expect to get what I paid for and if this is what this hotel offers at this price, this must be really the signs of the times in the US...that they are in recession and will stay this way for a decade more with no more cash to upgrade their hotels and provide people with rooms worth their money. Disappointment is a kind word to describe this hotel. I don't think the Kimpton hotels will make it through the next decade.

Reviews.Title: “Parking and location devaluate the property.”
Reviews.Author: Duggars
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the staff was extremely helpful. They have what seemed like the hotels mascot who's name escapes us at the moment but is a well behaved chocolate lab. They dress him up in Giants gear on game days lol. Back to the hotel: the location is in a very busy, dirty, area of the city. Although there are many stores - and a shopping mall - right next to it, the bums begging for money are intolerable. We even had 2 - YES 2 - dressed in suits who were OBVIOUSLY begging for money, pretending to be businessmen who needed a couple of bucks for gas. Then there's the parking situation which devaluated this property even more. We ended up paying $48 PER DAY - For two days. That was a waste in our eyes as the valet attendant had us waiting 20 minutes on of the times we were trying to turn in the car. Another plus is a free wine reception daily - however we aren't wine drinkers so this didn't sway us at all. I wouldn't recommend the hotel f you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Up there with the best”
Reviews.Author: Panda_and_Flossy
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to San Francisco after staying at the Intercontinental Mark Hopkins. On a dollar for dollar basis The Palomar was considerably better value. The rooms are very modern and spacious with nice bathrooms (Great Shower) and the most fantastic bathrobes you have ever seen (One leopard and one zebra). The hotel is ideally located virtually next door to the Westfield Centre and only a few blocks from Union Square. The guys on the door are very helpful as were the reception staff. Also the daily complimentary wine tasting and flavoured waters on reception were nice touches. If Trip advisor allowed half star ratings we would give this hotel 4.5 stars - Most people would give this hotel five stars but our criterea for five stars is a truely memorable hotel which we would talk about for years following the visit. In all an excellent hotel which we would highly recommend (and we will probably return to this hotel sometime in the future)

Reviews.Title: “Top-notch stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Placitasman65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The staff was warm and welcoming (even the hotel mascot, a precious labrador named Maverick). The property itself is amazing: from the decor, to the spacious rooms to the wonderful food in the Fifth Floor Restaurant, it's all A+. We will return here again and again. This was our second visit to the Palomar, having first visited there in Fall 2009. Book this hotel...you won't regret it. Kimpton Hotels really knows how to treat their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous oasis in downtown SF”
