When we got Expedia on the phone and they talked to him, they said he was unpleasant. What stunned us was there was no apology, no recognition we were about to be massively inconvenienced, nothing. No comp, nothing. Stone-faced and unwilling to concede we were customers. It is as if we are doing them a favor staying at their hotel. We decided to go elsewhere and will never stay at a Kimpton hotel again. Unfortunately, poor service seems to be a hallmark of Kimpton. We stayed at the Vintage Plaza in Portland -- no wake calls, forgot to call town car, bad room next to heat exchanger. Kimpton is style over substance, with a sniffy attitude froms staff. Bad service is not isolated at Kimpton. Do them a favor and stay there or do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. Awful, awful, awful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Syphrite
Reviews.Content: This hotel made my boyfriend and I feel like superstars. They were incredibly attentive from the moment we arrived....even allowing us to check in to our room 3 hours early. I even had a pair of pants dry cleaned in 4 hours. The room was very nicely appointed and clean. The decorations and ambiance were very modern and well done. The 5th Floor restaurant was SUPERB. We ate some of the best scallops ever there. We sat at the bar for a couple of drinks, the bartender and waitstaff were all very nice. When the bartender overheard my boyfriend and I discussing how we were going to make a reservation at a restaurant he immediately called and made the reservation for us. We didn't even have to ask! Upon check out the hotel arranged for a luxury town car to take us to the airport. We were extremely impressed by the service and location of this hotel. It is right in the center of everything: shopping, dining, tourism. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting the San Fran area.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly pleased, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a one night stop-over stay in the Hotel Palomar based on the positive reviews on this website and I certainly didn't disagree. We were greeted after a long journey in a friendly and professional manner by all members of staff. The room, although interior facing was nicely decorated and extremely quiet. The bed was the most comfortable bed I'd ever slept in a hotel which meant we had a wonderful nights sleep. The location of this hotel is brilliant if you want to be close to Union Square. It is just two blocks away and all flat walking, so no steep hills to climb! The only negative was the pricey restaurant in the hotel. We ate there being jet lagged and needing an early night but $23 for a couple of scallops, although very nice, was a little over the top!

Reviews.Title: “First class all the way”
Reviews.Author: rosebud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our 4 night stay at the Hotel Palomar. They honored my request for an exterior facing room, higher floor. Limited views of Market Street and nearby tall buildings/Marriott. Very spacious room, great layout and calming interior design with in room CD and all the tech equipment you could want. Phenomenal service, great location between Soma and Union Square shopping, a stone's throw from the Moscone Convention Center, half a short block from the Bart Station. We ate at the hotel's posh five star restaurant, "The Fifth Floor", which was a splurge but worth every penny for a memorable evening of out of this world cuisine, romantic atmosphere and doting service (the much more affordable breakfast was also very good, with quick and convenient service). A great home base in a world class city.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: jgodic
Reviews.Content: the palomar was a nice hotel. nothing special, the decorating was a bit generic. the service was excellent, everybody was very friendly and helpful. being so close to union square, it really was right in the middle of tourist central, but it made a good central location from which to explore some of the quieter neighborhoods of SF. if you are coming to shop at the big name stores, you probably couldnt do much better than the palomar for location and value. it is conveniently located close to a bart stop, which i wish i had known on the way there b.c our cab from OAK was $60 whereas the return trip on the bart was about $5 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar Christmas, 2004. Lobby felt more like an office building than hotel, though it still had appeal. Rooms were excellent. Chic decor. Well appointed and designed, cheerful and modern. Great little CD stereo with cool music assortment provided. Asian/Zen inspired touches in hallways that culminated in a impressive looking bar and restaurant on (and called) Fifth Floor. Well rated, offering french-modern cuisine. Excellent wine list (not just CA wines, strong on Burgundy). Good food. However, over priced. Small but servicable gym. We've stayed at places costing twice as much that haven't matched the Palomar (Klimpton owned).

Reviews.Title: “nice and different”
Reviews.Author: ATourist2day
Reviews.Content: The Palomar is not what we expected. It is very modern and has an understated European luxury feel to it. While the room was immaculate, it seemed small and the bathroom door gave little privacy. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room on the 4th floor had an outstanding view! The restaraunt is hidden and there really is no lobby to speak of, so waiting for friends to arrive was not convienent. On departure they offered a Lincoln Town car to take us to the Airport for the same price as a Taxi. A nice touch to end our vacation. All in all, not a bad place to stay. But I felt out of place as a tourist. It seems more like a high end Hotel for the Business traveller. The location was very conveinent to the cable cars, street cars and subway. DavidinHartford.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: heymista
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for large rooms in SF, then Palomar may be a great value. While it is expensive during the week, they have great weekend rates and the rooms are huge in comparison. We had a suite and our friends had a standard room, and we were both very happy with the accomodations. We found the staff very helpful. The only knock I would have is that the restaurant is overpriced. We would definitely stay again. Can't beat the location if you want be near Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Great location, great staff, great decor. Shower pressure could be better.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's true, it is a hassle to have to go downstairs to grab coffee. We were pretty surprised by this too, but we really didn't mind much. It was actually kind of nice to get out and stretch our legs in the morning. The staff is incredibly friendly, helpful, prompt, and polite. They had good recommendations, and were very accomodating with any requests. We didn't get a chance to try the restaurant. We stayed in a Deluxe King room on the 5th floor for an average of $167 per night. Not bad for the days around New Year's Eve. No street noise, great decor, big room. CD player and free newspaper in the morning were nice touches. My biggest complaint was the water pressure in the shower. It may have just been our room, but it should have had a lot more water pressure. Otherwise the bathroom was comfortable and clean. Really didn't like the Aveda shampoo and conditioner at all, IMHO. Smelled more like salad dressing than shampoo, but that's just me. Dries out your hair pretty badly too. I'd bring my own next time. Also, I was very grateful to the reviewer who mentioned the parking rates are $36 per day. I believe they have now been increased to $37. At first we thought this was outrageous, but when we called around to other hotels, we found that this was actually fairly standard for the area. Lastly, the location is IDEAL! Right next to market street, Union Square, shops, restaurants, etc. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Palomar!!”
Reviews.Author: funnygirl1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Palomar and it was fantastic! Who cares if they have a coffee maker in their room? Everything about the place was great. We took a morning flight so we got to the hotel way before check-in time. The front desk said "no problem, we can put you in an inside room now or store your luggage while you explore the city and we'll give you a city view room later"! Took the latter suggestion and when we arrived back our room was ready. The room was not the biggest I've ever seen (what in San Francisco is) but was very stylish and clean. The bed was as good as sleeping at home! The Aveda bath products were a great treat! Everyone on staff at the Palomar was courteous, polite and VERY helpful. The location is perfect for Union Square shopping and exploring by public transportation. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else when visiting San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great fun...”
Reviews.Author: uniceverse
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Palomar has revived my love for the Kimpton Group hotels. Recent stays at a couple of their locations were a bit disappointing in terms of overall condition and maintanance- no doubt it's difficult to keep up with high room turnover- however this was not at all the case at the Palomar. I never had occasion to use the Concierge but the desk staff was always pleasant and accomodating (a noisy fan in my first room was easily resolved by a move to a new room) with a friendly greeting each and everytime I came or went. The location is unbeatable- being close to Union Square, the business district, public transportation if you need it, etc.- and the rooms themselves are quiet and very comfortable (high marks for the fun and kicky decore) with great housekeeping. A very pleasant expereince compels me to give this hotel very high marks.

Reviews.Title: “Great design hotel”
Reviews.Author: hartss
Reviews.Content: I respectfully disagree with the coffee complainers who have posted recently. If you want that, stay at the chain hotels. This place is for people who appreciate good design. It is residential in feeling, and unbelievably comfortable in that dark-wood, cocoon way. I felt very hip staying here! The front desk staff and bellmen were friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the Fifth Floor restaurant was quite good, if a bit expensive. Can't beat the location, either. For dinner, try Annabelle's a couple of doors down. It is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, loved the decor, where's the coffee?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the other reviewers: this is a great little hotel with very friendly staff. My wife arranged for us to have a room with an extra-long bed, which was a treat -- go for this if you're over 6'4". A few folks note the absence of a coffee maker. This is a huge mistake. I want my caffeine without having to trudge to the lobby. We stayed on the 5th floor, where the pretentious restaurant is. We slept in till ten, and the restaurant was already closed, contrary to advertising. So I threw clothes on, went to the lobby, and there was a crowd around the coffee carafes, and "regular" was out. If you can provide me with a CD player and music to listen to, you can provide me with a coffee maker. Every Holiday Inn Express has one. It does not detract from your ultra Zen hip coolness to have a friggin' coffee maker in the room! The hotel does not serve lunch and you can't get coffee on demand. This is a great hotel, but it is not full service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but give me in-room coffee and reasonable wine prices”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar Nov. 18th-19th. Booked their "great rate" of $129. The hotel is very beautiful, and the rooms very nicely appointed. My husband enjoyed the "tall room" with the extra long king bed and high showerhead. Our only gripes were that there are no in-room coffee makers (probably too "tacky" for their decor), and the wines-by-the-glass were extremely expensive. We don't want to have to get dressed and traipse down to the lobby for morning coffee, or deal with pricey room service in the morning just for a cuppa joe. Sorry. (The Relais-Chateaux hotels have the common sense to put coffee/tea service in the hallways, at least.) And while I appreciate their "hand-picked" wine list, they could offer more reasonably-priced selections. It's California after all, land of countless great wineries and of course 2-buck Chuck! Pretentious wine lists don't impress me. I'd consider going back if those two issues were addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Palomar Hotel was Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: travelcrazy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved the hotel. The location is perfect. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, Chinatown, the Ferry Building etc... The Bart Station is right under the hotel too. Very convenient to take the Bart to Oakland Airport and a lot less expensive than a town car. (60.00 vs. 5.15). Rooms are ultra-hip and spotless. We had an Executive King on the 5th floor, and the street noise was barely audible. Great view of the Flood Building, and Stockton St. Very comfortable bed, pillows, chair etc.. bathroom has ample counter space and great Aveda products. Their gym is small but adequate. We really enjoyed the Serenity Channel and the Yoga Channel. Great coffee in the lobby every morning too. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. The staff treated us royally and couldn't do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in the city.....”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Palomar is a small hip hotel. Make sure that if you bring a car that you get the parking package or else it is 36 bucks a day. Location is ok, a short walk to Union Square. A little nicer than the W hotel. Fifth Floor restaurant was very good but not mind blowing, bring a load of money to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd seen the Palomar featured on the cable show "Great Hotels", and made it my mission to visit there. It was better than I expected. Every person working there was extremely friendly & made me feel as if my comfort was a priority. The contemporary decor was wonderful & exactly suited to my taste. After my 3-day stay, I knew several employees by name & look forward to returning in a few months. The Hotel Palomar will always be my hotel of choice in San Francisco. I only have one minor suggestion - guests could use just a little more drawer space for clothes. A small chest of drawers would solve that & not take anything away from the lovely rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, Zen place.”
Reviews.Author: talldude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Palomar for three nights. It was very nice - loved the leopard skin carpet, as well as the rest of the modern-yet-warm furnishings. Very complete room except for the noticeable absence of a coffee maker. There was, however, free coffee in the lobby until 10:30am. Good location for shopping or tourists. Free wireless internet was great, but the TV did not offer many channels. The "serenity" channel was kind of a kick, and my girlfriend liked the yoga channel. This is kind of a Zen place. (there was even a copy of "The Teachings of Buddha" next to the Bible!) The clock radio could not seem to get decent reception of any channels. The honor bar was well stocked, but pricey (no surprise there). Once again we were happy to find Aveda toiletries, and we took as many home as we could! We found the staff rather helpful, and they were super friendly. Every staff member that passed us would offer a greeting. (certainly mandated by the management) One word of caution: parking was $36 per night! Have dinner at LuLu's if you can - they have a well-stocked bar, and our bartender was great (a blonde, bespectacled woman). Avoid Annabelle's Bistro - we had a bad experience there.

Reviews.Title: “A real disappointment”
Reviews.Author: JimB58
Reviews.Content: Palomar review We were put in a very small room (Cruise ship cabin size) rm 519. Cheerful staff, but not really helpful. We asked for additional towels, but they never arrived. The front desk did not have any change for tips (no change for a $20). The Fifth Floor lounge is supposed to close at 12:00 on Friday, but was not serving any more after 11:00pm. The in room safe is located in the small closet, need to remove bag stand and any luggage in closet to access room safe. Could be considered an extra level of security. $36-per day parking charge is the highest I have ever paid. take BART then cab it. There are the usual assortment of bums and winos on Market Street, but not in front of the hotel. This place is not worth the money-definitely not a 4 star property in my opinion. The view of Old Navy from our cabin was a new take on window shopping , some interior rooms had a view of a garden with fountain. comfy bed, very sm bath, pocket door, nice furnishings in room. Other rooms seemed a little bigger than ours. We did not have time when we checked in to request another room. I don't know if it would have helped. Newspapers available only if you ask they are not offered or provided with room service breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, Immature employees”
Reviews.Author: Nshores33
Reviews.Content: The hotel, in itself, was awesome. The room was cute with a nice view and a great location. However, the front desk could care less about you. They made rude remarks about guests in front of me. Hung out talking to each other and ignoring guests. Also, DO NOT use the concierge. We tried 7 times to get alcatraz tickets through them and they never left us a message to confirm whether they succeeded in arranging the tickets. Finally, they told us we were booked and could go anytime. But when we arrived to the pier, we were told that we had a specific time and that we missed our boat. Consequently we had to wait standby for two hours. Terrible service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: smiles2u
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Beautiful views of Market Street. Convenient location to shopping and great restaurants. Luxurious rooms. Friendly, helpful staff. Loved it. Will stay here again and again!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: MaddieBBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: My family and I travelled to Sonoma to attend a wedding. We stayed one night at the Palomar. The rooms are beautifully decorated. The beds are incredibly comfortable. The bathrooms are gorgeous. However, what most impressed us was the level of customer service the staff provided. Although we only stayed a short time, the staff could not have been more gracious. They allowed us to check in early, booked us a tour of the city, acquired baseball tickets for us, made us dinner reservations, and rented us a car to drive to Sonoma County. I cannot compliment the hotel enough on the level of service and quality of the employees. I recommend the hotel to everyone I know who may travel to San Francisco. I would never stay anywhere else in that city. Bravo and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palomar, hated the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for two nights in August, 2004. The hotel is very comfortable and the staff is outstanding. They go out of their way to assist with directions or whatever you need. However, the area around the hotel is unappealing. Many homeless on the street were upsetting to my kids, who are 11 and 15. Really didn't feel very safe on the streets around there. Wouldn't recommend for families. Complimentary tea and coffee were wonderful in the morning, but it would be nice if they also offered hot chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: shedeez
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed in the hotel during valentine's day weekend this year. The staff was friendly and decor is very nice and modern. I was told when I booked my room, I'd be given an updated...well, it didn't happen. When we got to our room, it was small. The entrance to our door was right next to another room. We could here those people coming in and out of their room...and we could even hear them play there music loud. The bed was not comfy at all. The pictures of the rooms and bathrooms on the website looks better. I must say though, the hotel is conveniently located near Yerba Buena Gardens, Sony Meteron, Union Square (shopping) and the cable cars. If you don't care about room, but would like something close to everything, then come here. Otherwise, I don't think it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, but very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AmberJane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palomar for two nights on our way to Maui and were so pleased to have picked this place as our stop over. The employees were so friendly and helpful. The rooms weren't huge but were plenty big and were decorated very chic. The hotel bar was great, the bartenders were very entertaining and the drinks were poured with a heavy hand :) It had a great location, just steps from the trolly turnaround. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that Wreaks Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Balconylove
Reviews.Content: Any traveler that appreciates boutique hotels MUST visit the Palomar when in San Francisco. I spent two nights there after researching boutique hotels on the internet and this one just kept coming back to me as the one to choose. What a great decision!!! For starters great door service, very friendly, informative and helpful front desk, georgous decorated rooms (we had a standard King), a tiny lobby but beautiful and classy, pet friendly (I brought my Yorkie and he received his own water & food bowls), the breakfast was a bit pricey but gourmet, the location is right in the heart of everything in San Francisco and yet you can't hear a sound from inside the rooms knowing that just outside is the hustle and bustle of the city!A simple yet lovely Zen Garden accentuates the inner courtyard of the hotel from window view. Great decor!!!! WE LOVED IT!!!!! Everything was fantastic! Next trip we plan on trying out one of their suites. This hotel is a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Palomar is amazing...”
Reviews.Author: JackieDC
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Palomar was everything I had hoped for- so much that Iâ€™m not sure to begin! I found the Palomar through an air/hotel package for a great price, and we visited from July 15th to the 18th. Our flight arrived earlier then the official check in time, but the staff allowed us to check in, which was nice. Located right off of 4th street in downtown SF, the Palomar proved to have an amazing location right off of Union Square. The lobby was sophisticated and a bit on the small side, but that is not a complaint! The employees were gracious and professional every time we passed them on our way out or in, no matter the time. The room was on the trendy side of gorgeous: spacious with comfortable beds, a great size bathroom, and several amenities (cd player, fax machine, and cordless phone, added to the money safe and locked bar). Our view was toward Union Square, but the lights werenâ€™t a problem when the curtain was closed, and we couldnâ€™t hear any noise from outside. The bar/restaurant was a great addition as well (martinis were wonderful). The day we checked out the hotel kept our bags until out flight left to allow us to sightsee with ease, and reclaim out baggage quickly. Simply put, our stay was perfect. The Hotel Palomar was one of the best hotels that I have ever stayed at, and I will be staying there again when I return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Feb of 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved it. Simply put it was a great hotel in the heart of SF. You are by the Bart Station and the Trolley cars. You are near a Walgreenâ€™s so if you are missing any of your toiletries or looking for that small snack you can go there in a heart beat. The Lobby is small but it makes it up for its decor and service. The rooms were great. I had plenty of room with a nice view of the city. The noise level was that of a city so I was fine. They had ample closet space and within the closet was a user friendly room safe. The bed linins were soft and the pillows not rock hard or super soft. I had a wonderful good night sleep with their comfy bed. It was very nice to have a mini stereo system that allowed me to play my CDs and they offered Yoga straps, blocks and mats if one wanted to practice yoga along with the program they play on the Hotel TV channel. The bath products were Avada so very user friendly and not to mention great product line. The mini bar was well stocked with great products if one chooses to indulge. The maid service was prompt and changed my linins and towels each day. I ate the 5th restaurant which is rated one of the best in the city. Great food with lots of creativity. They had an extensive wine list which one should not miss. The food was not only presented well but taste was absolutely to die for. The fusion of east and west was well established and melded well. Believe me I have ate my fair share of bad fusion food. Overall this is a great hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect luxury location for Moscone events”
Reviews.Author: mjmorin
Reviews.Content: When forced to attend a conference at the Moscone, this little hotel is perfect. It is two blocks away from the convention center, has excellent wireless service, a staff that continues to try to please customers and is small enough to avoid the bulk of conventioners. Of note, room service does not start early enough to be useful on the weekends. However, the restaurant is user friendly. I was quite pleased with the attitudes and demeanor of the staff. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Made my 30th Birthday Special”
Reviews.Author: Beardsh
Reviews.Content: The Palomar was my first destination when visiting the West Coast in February 2004. We stayed for 5 nights and I celebrated my 30th birthday there. We did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the food but found it be ideal for our needs, perfectly situated, modern and clean and the staff were excellent. We turned up out of the blue one day with a couple of bicycles we had hired and they kindly helped us to store these for a couple of nights. Staff recommended places to go and eat and were pleasant and helpful at all times particularly when it came for us to hire a car, they provided a map and directions to our next destination - Lake Tahoe. Our last night we booked to stay at the far more expensive Parc 55 hotel and it was appalling. Situated right on the edge of the rough part of town, Tenderloin. If you want a large grand fancy lobby with crap service, small dirty rooms and staff who are uninterested and barely speak English then I strongly recommend Parc 55. If however, you want a clean, stylish and tranquil place to relax then the Palomar will be right up your street. I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. I wish so much we had booked in here for the last night of our holiday and would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Four star location, one star service”
Reviews.Author: RStokes
Reviews.Content: The palomar is an elegant hotel with a good central downtown location. The restaurant is rated highly by a number of gourment magazines and rooms are pleasant if on the small side. However the front desk staff have no interest in helping customers outside of routine check in and check out. Service is more akin to a 1 star hotel. I would rate the hotel 4 stars for location and 1 star for service

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Zero Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: browngt5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Palomar for three nights (06/02-06/05) and had a wonderful experience. The location is perfect: close to Union Square, Market Street, and Transit. Very stylish hotel with modern decor and comfortable beds. We had a eighth-floor room facing Fourth Street, but noise was never a factor! The service from check-in to check-out was flawless and pleasant. Mel's Diner, one-half block away, is a reasonably priced and good option for breakfast. If you bring a car, the Fifth & Mission Garage is a half-block away and is only $20 a night. Well worth the extra $$$, since there are definitely some crummy hotels in this city!

Reviews.Title: “Nice botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanapepe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great! The rooms are avg. size, very clean, stocked with all the ammenities you need. Staff is very helpful. Location is near shopping, cable car turn around and convenient to public transportation which is so reasonable. If you get a room away from the street it's very quiet. Their top rated restaurant has fabulous food with astronomical prices. Wait staff is enthusiastic tho a tad young. Omly drawback that being on Market St. you see a lot of pan handlers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite!”
Reviews.Author: SuzInAZ1950
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the lovely Palomar the weekend of 3/14/04 - it was a belated Valentine's Day gift from my husband. In that I love boutique hotels, this was another pleasant surprise in the heart of downtown San Francisco (my fav being the Pan Pacific). These rooms were much larger, and although the bathroom was not as elegant as the Pan, the Fuji bathtub was wonderful - so good for soaking the feet after hitting the streets all day. I filled it to the brim knowing that I was depleting the world of water!! It was very very relaxing. The room was a bit too contemporary for me, but did not detract from my stay. I have two complaints about the room. The way our suite was set up, you couldn't sit on the sofa and look directly at the t.v. You had to lay on the sofa to be head-on with the t.v. Also, there are no coffee making faciliites. In a room that is over $400/night, you would expect to find such a convenience - after all...you get that in the $59/night Best Western! My big gripe with the area, not the hotel, is that you are in downtown San Francisco, and there are few good restaurants around, so it's either order from room service or go to the bistro down the street (and by the way, room service gets its food from the bistro down the street). So if you are going to stay at the Palomar, keep that in mind. You will either have to go to the financial or theater district or go elsewhere. If you DO get to Fisherman's Wharf, eat at Scoma's - they have the best (albeit expensive) seasfood going! I'd stay at the Paloma again, but before I'd go back, I'd stay at the Hotel Monaco - it's sister hotel (both are pet-friendly by the way). BY THE WAY - SKIP THE COURTYARD ROOMS. All you see is 3 other interior walls and you look down through a glass roof into "Old Navy." This is a gripe I almost forgot. We got to the hotel early and stowed our luggage and went to get lunch (see note above about eateries in the area) and do some shopping. We hiked all the way to Chinatown before finding any place for lunch - the hotels in the area do not have coffee shops! Anyway, the front desk told us to be back at 2 pm, and we were, and our room still wasn't ready. The staff said that the people were still checking out. They had us wait in the 5th floor loung, very very dark- no coffee pot, no water, no nothing but couches & lounge chairs. 45 minutes later, I sent my husband to complain. The front desk said the couple had spilled something on the carpet & they were cleaning it up, and did we want an "interior" room instead. DO NOT GET AN INTERIOR ROOM (see note above). If we had been given our exterior room, we would have been able to sit there and watch the St. Patrick's Day parade on Sunday. The view stunk. All in all, maybe I won't go back there again. I think I'll stay down by the Wharf where there's tons of restaurants & things to do (but I STILL loved that bathtub)!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, poor service, and fraudulent advertising”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Palomar for 6 nights in March. I found a deal for 137/night on Orbitz and I saw on Palomar's website that they offer to match any internet rate and to include with that a free upgrade to the "best available room" (offer has since changed to "best room in next 'tier.'" While they honored the rate, the refused to honor the upgrade, even though a quick check on the web showed that better rooms were available. (I read about this exact problem right here on trip-advisor reviews, so I wasn't surprised). They basically said that the room I got WAS an upgrade, because it was an exterior room, instead of an interior room. This is just ridiculous, because their website, on which they promise the upgrade, makes no mention of this distinction. And besides, the deal we were offered said "best available room," not "slightly better room." When I discussed this problem with Brian Fenwick, the general manager, he was rude and unhelpful (another review on this website makes this same point; take note, Kimpton Group!!). He claimed that the website booking system was incorrect about better rooms being available and that I WAS, in fact, in the best available room. Before speaking with Brian, I had a friend call the front desk and try to book a suite; she was informed that they had several suites available. When I told this to Brian, he said that while the rooms may be available to others for booking, but that they were "allotted," so he was unable to upgrade me. This is nonsense. I'm not sure what is more disturbing: that they wouldn't honor the upgrade, or that Brian would tell a bold-faced lie and say the rooms were unavailable. Besides this unpleasantness, the hotel was fine: a nice big room, service once a day (although they say you should get it twice), and a big clean bathroom. Just don't expect the web upgrade deal to be honored.

Reviews.Title: “Very Classy”
Reviews.Author: termoo
Reviews.Content: Our whole family recently stayed at the Hotel Palomar in one of their 2-bedroom suites. (January 30) We had a gift certificate from Kimpton Hotels, and decided to splurge with an overnight in San Francisco (though we only live 45 minutes away) when we went to see "The Lion King." We were cheerfully greeted by the doorman each time we came and went. In fact, on Saturday, when the staff was different (and less friendly, by the way) my 10-year-old daughter mentioned that she missed "that nice door guy." Our room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The furnishings, carpet, lamps and accessories were tasteful and sophisticated. All of the artwork on the walls was gorgeous and interesting, and we even had a live palm in the dining area. Two of the kids donned their swim suits and sat in the bathtub as though it were a hot tub. Having such a deep Fuji tub was definitely a treat! We loved looking down on Market St. from our huge windows throughout the suite. There were two free apples and two free bottles of water waiting for us, as well as a VERY well-stocked mini-bar and fridge that we had to quickly keep the kids away from! The exercise room has a nice view of the rooftop garden and an interesting view through the glass ceiling of the Old Navy store that the hotel sits on top of. Although we didn't eat there, the restaurant was quite striking with a very appetizing menu. Someday without the kids... I was very happy with the location and the level of service. We only stayed one night, and I left wanting to stay a few more. I would definitely recommend this as a classy and comfortable place to spend time in San Francisco.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palomar San Francisco - a Kimpton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12 Fourth St, San Francisco, CA 94103
